Halozyme will pay $5.6 for each share of Antares Pharma, a premium of 49.7% to the company's last closing price. "The addition of Antares...further strengthens our position as a leading drug delivery company," Halozyme CEO Helen Torley said.

176.title: Google CEO Pichai to co-chair council to help Ukrainian refugees settle in US
176.article_body: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai will co-chair a new CEO council with over 30 CEOs to help Ukrainians and Afghans resettle in the US. "It builds on Google's long-standing support for immigrants, dreamers and refugees, and will help people through access to technology, jobs and more," Pichai said. The Welcome.US CEO council is co-chaired by Accenture CEO Julie Sweet.

177.title: BJP's Tejasvi Surya, others detained on way to Rajasthan's Karauli
177.article_body: BJP Yuva Morcha chief and MP Tejasvi Surya was on Wednesday detained by Rajasthan Police at Hindaun-Mahwa border as he tried to visit violence-hit Karauli along with others. "Section 144 is not in place at where we are now...It's our constitutional right to go to Karauli," he said. Earlier today, he met victims of the violence at a Jaipur hospital.

178.title: 'Made in India' COVID-19 vaccines better than Pfizer, Moderna: Adar Poonawalla
178.article_body: Covishield maker Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla claimed that "Made in India" COVID-19 vaccines have provided better protection than mRNA vaccines like Pfizer and Moderna. "It's good that...vaccines like...Pfizer and Moderna aren't introduced in India," he said. "In countries like the US, people have taken 2nd and 3rd booster dose and still many are getting infected," he added.

179.title: Played dholak at Rishi, Neetu's wedding; RK weddings have best food: Subhash
179.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai recalled playing the dholak (hand drum) at the wedding of actor-couple Rishi Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor in 1980. He said, "Chintu (Rishi) and Neetu got married in 'RK' style." "Raj Kapoor...used to treat the film industry as a family. The Kapoors are very warm people. RK weddings have the best of food, drinks and music," he added.

180.title: Don’t need to be taught what Hindutva is, it’s in Shiv Sena's blood: Sanjay Raut
180.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that his party does not need to be taught what Hindutva is. "It (Hindutva) is in Shiv Sena's blood. Whenever Hindutva was attacked, at that time, it was not the BJP that came to the forefront. It was us, Balasaheb Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray," Raut added.

181.title: Request PM to immediately withdraw 'Achhe Din': Kharge on rising inflation
181.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that inflation was at its highest in the last 17 months and asked PM Narendra Modi to withdraw his "Achhe Din" statement. Taking to Twitter, he said, "At 7%, inflation is now highest in 17 months. I humbly request PM to immediately withdraw these 'Achhe Din'. People of India have had enough of 'good times'."

182.title: BJP should change its name to Modi-Shah party: Congress’ Kuldeep Rathore
182.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Kuldeep Singh Rathore said BJP has become a party of two people and it should change its name to "Modi-Shah party". His remark came in reaction to BJP chief JP Nadda’s "Congress is neither Indian nor national" comment. "He should know the history of Congress before making such a remark," Rathore added.

183.title: Halting debt payments will pressurise Sri Lanka's banking sector: Ex-PM
183.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that the government's move to temporarily halt foreign debt payments will put additional pressure on country's banking sector amid ongoing economic crisis. He added that the new finance minister should discuss the prevailing situation with International Monetary Fund. Sri Lanka declared on Tuesday that it'll default on its $51 billion external debt.

184.title: Baby monkey hugging dead mother rescued by TN volunteers; IAS officer shares footage
184.article_body: IAS officer Supriya Sahu has shared a video of a baby monkey being fed milk after it was rescued by volunteers at the Besant Memorial Animal Dispensary in Tamil Nadu. "Kudos to volunteers at the Besant Memorial Animal Dispensary for saving this baby monkey who was found hugging her dead mother. Thank you for your service," Sahu tweeted.

185.title: I'm happy Ranbir is getting married; will decide reception details today: Randhir
185.article_body: Speaking about Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, the former's uncle, veteran actor Randhir Kapoor, said, "Ranbir is going to get married but not today. It's around...April 15. I'm...happy [for him]." When asked if there will be a reception, Randhir said, "I'm on my way back (to Mumbai). I was in Goa...So we'll discuss that today and decide."

186.title: Dube got nearly impossible elevation in 102-metre six vs RCB: Manjrekar
186.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said CSK all-rounder Shivam Dube has a natural gift of hitting the ball a long way like Yuvraj Singh. "Josh Hazlewood got it right, bowled it full...Dube was deep inside the crease and to get that kind of elevation, it's almost impossible," added Manjrekar while discussing the all-rounder's 102-metre maximum in the 20th over.

187.title: 5-yr-old tribal girl kidnapped, murdered in Gujarat's Surat, 1 arrested
187.article_body: One person was arrested after a 5-year-old tribal girl was kidnapped and murdered in Punagam area of Surat, Gujarat on Wednesday. According to police, the accused took away the girl while she was asleep. His intention was to commit rape, however, the girl raised an alarm, following which he killed her on the spot, police added.

188.title: SC seeks status report in Haridwar hate speech case from state govt
188.article_body: The Supreme Court has sought a status report from Uttarakhand government regarding the progress in the investigation into the Haridwar hate speech case. During the hearing, counsel appearing for the Uttarakhand government told the apex court that the police registered four FIRs and in three of them, charge sheets have been filed.

189.title: Woman gives birth under mobile phone light in Haryana due to power cut
189.article_body: Following a power cut, a woman had to give birth under the light of mobile phones at a community health centre in Haryana's Alewa on Tuesday. She was taken to the health centre on Monday night as she was in labour, her mother-in-law said. Power failure at the facility causes lot of problems, said the health centre in-charge, Dr Vinod.

190.title: It's between me and my family: Quinton De Kock on decision to quit Test cricket
190.article_body: Opening up on his decision to announce retirement from Tests aged 29, South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Quinton De Kock said, "My reasoning is kept to myself. It's between me and my family." He added, "Obviously, it was a shock to everyone. But I made my decision...It is what it is. Doesn't take away the fact that I still love the game."

191.title: Delhi Transport Minister flags off 80 AC low-floor CNG buses
191.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot on Wednesday flagged off 80 new air-conditioned low-floor CNG buses from Rajghat depot. "Under the guidance of CM Arvind Kejriwal we're committed to making Delhi's public transport service strong," Gahlot tweeted. These buses also have an Intelligent Transport System (ITS) through which all these buses can be monitored on a real-time basis, officials said.

192.title: Willing to talk to protesters: Sri Lankan PM amid economic crisis
192.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa said he's "willing to talk to" the protesters occupying the entrance to the President's office and listen to their ideas for resolving the ongoing economic and political crisis. The protesters camped out for a fifth day demanding the resignation of PM's brother, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, blaming him for the country's worst economic situation in decades.

193.title: Urvashi to make her H'wood debut with 365 Days actor Michele Morrone: Reports
193.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela is all set to make her Hollywood Debut with '365 Days' actor Michele Morrone. According to reports, Urvashi will be seen as a lead in the movie. The working title for the film is 'Renata Fonte', which will be produced by Netflix, Tomasz Mandes and will be directed by '365 Days' director Barbara Bialowas, reports added.

194.title: COVID-19 vaccination centres to be shut in Mumbai on April 14
194.article_body: All government-run COVID-19 vaccination centres will be closed on Thursday, April 14, in Mumbai, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has said. The vaccination will resume on Friday,  April 15. Meanwhile, on Tuesday, Mumbai reported 52 new COVID-19 cases and no deaths. Only one patient was hospitalised yesterday and the recovery rate in Mumbai stands at 98%.

195.title: Google to invest $9.5 billion in US offices, data centres in 2022
195.article_body: Google has announced that it will invest $9.5 billion in US offices and data centres over 2022, up from $7 billion last year. It's expected to create 12,000 new jobs by 2022-end. Google will open a new office in Atlanta. "It might seem counterintuitive to step up our investment in physical offices even as we embrace more flexibility," Google said.

196.title: No funeral till minister is arrested: K'taka contractor's family
196.article_body: The family of the Karnataka contractor Santosh Patil, who allegedly killed himself on Tuesday, has demanded arrest of all the accused in the case, including Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa. "Everybody whose names are mentioned in the FIR must be arrested. We want justice for our brother," said Patil's brother. "We won't conduct the funeral till Eshwarappa is arrested," he added.

197.title: AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi acquitted in 2 hate speech cases
197.article_body: A Hyderabad court on Wednesday acquitted All India Majlis-E-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) leader Akbaruddin Owaisi in two hate speech cases registered against him. The prosecution failed to produce proper evidence for the same, the court said. It directed Akbaruddin not to make any controversial speeches in future. He had made the alleged hate speeches in Nirmal and Nizamabad in 2012.

198.title: My 1st IPL wicket is one of my favourite batters, I'm happy: CSK's Theekshana
198.article_body: CSK's 21-year-old spinner Maheesh Theekshana picked four wickets while conceding 33 runs in his four overs against RCB. Talking about the match, Theekshana said, "My first IPL wicket is of one of my favourite batters [Faf du Plessis]...I'm really happy." Apart from RCB captain Plessis, Theekshana dismissed Anuj Rawat, Shahbaz Ahmed and Suyash Prabhudessai in the game.

199.title: Russian soldiers gangrape 11-yr-old boy; tied up mother forced to watch in Ukraine
199.article_body: Ukrainian officials have said that Russian soldiers allegedly gangraped an 11-year-old boy and tied up his mother to a chair, forcing her to watch. Ukraine's Parliamentary Commissioner for Human Rights Lyudmila Denisova said the boy was raped in Ukrainian town of Bucha, where several dead civilians showed signs of torture after it was recaptured.

200.title: Heart inflammation after taking COVID-19 vaccination rare: Lancet study
200.article_body: The overall risk of developing myopericarditis (inflammation of the heart muscle) after taking COVID-19 vaccination is very low, a Lancet study has found. The risk of developing the condition was higher for people who received mRNA vaccines with 22.6 cases per million doses than for those who took non-mRNA vaccines with 7.9 cases per million doses, the researchers said.

201.title: Want to correct public perception that JNU is 'tukde-tukde': VC
201.article_body: The Jawaharlal Nehru University Vice-Chancellor, Professor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit, on Wednesday said people have a misconception about the university. "I want to correct the public perception that we are tukde-tukde...after I have taken over I've not seen anybody talking like that," she added. She further said that JNU is as nationalistic as anybody else.

202.title: True words: Zelenskyy after Biden calls Russia's invasion 'genocide'
202.article_body: Reacting to US President Joe Biden labelling Russia's invasion of Ukraine a "genocide", Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said they were "true words of a true leader". "Calling things by their names is essential to stand up to evil," Zelenskyy added. "We're grateful for US assistance provided so far and we urgently need more heavy weapons to prevent...Russian atrocities," he said.

203.title: Oil India's production and drilling unaffected after cyber attack
203.article_body: Oil India Limited (OIL) PRO Tridiv Hazarika said the company's exploration and production work have not been affected in the suspected cyber attack in its field headquarters in Assam's Duliajan. The software handling functions like contractor and vendor payments is also functioning normally. OIL's Duliajan office had witnessed a cyber attack on Sunday which affected a few systems and servers.

204.title: Metro helped passengers save 269 million hrs of travel time in 2021: DMRC
204.article_body: Passengers cumulatively saved a "mammoth 269 million hours of travel time" in 2021 by using Delhi Metro services, the DMRC said on Tuesday. The Delhi Metro also helped "remove over five lakh vehicles from the streets of the national capital daily in 2021. This figure has also increased from about 4.74 lakh in 2019", the statement said.

205.title: TV actress Nikki Sharma deletes all social media posts, writes 'I tried but I am tired'
205.article_body: TV actress Nikki Sharma, who has been a part of shows including 'Sasural Simar Ka' and 'Brahmarakshas 2', recently deleted all her social media posts. She also shared a note on Instagram Stories which read, "I tried but I am tired, I want to be free from my own thoughts now." The actress has reportedly been depressed for some time.

206.title: Video of MS Dhoni plotting Virat Kohli's wicket goes viral
206.article_body: A video of CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni plotting RCB batter Virat Kohli's dismissal has gone viral. In the video, Dhoni can be seen moving Shivam Dube from fine leg to deep square leg for Kohli in RCB's fifth over bowled by Mukesh Choudhary. On the next ball, Kohli hit the ball towards deep square leg and was caught by Dube.

207.title: Matter of concern: Chirag on bomb explosion near CM Nitish's 'Jansabha' site
207.article_body: Reacting to the bomb explosion incident near Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' in Nalanda district, LJP supremo Chirag Paswan said, "It's a matter of concern and I condemn it." "There is repeated negligence, investigation should be done into the matter. This is the second attack on him within a month," he added. Earlier, a man attacked Nitish Kumar in Bakhtiyarpur.

208.title: Pic shows Hyd policeman giving food to elderly woman lying unconscious on road
208.article_body: A police official of the Hyderabad City Police offered food and water to an elderly woman who was lying unconscious on a road near the Sea World hotel lane. The police also shared a picture that shows the policeman offering idlis to the woman. Police said they had received a complaint that one woman was lying there.

209.title: Won't resign: K'taka minister named in contractor suicide case
209.article_body: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa, who was named in an FIR after 40-year-old contractor Santhosh Patil died by alleged suicide, said on Wednesday that there's no question of him resigning. In a suicide note, Patil had purportedly blamed Eshwarappa for his step. "The death note is false propaganda," Eshwarappa claimed, adding that he "has seen 100 cases like this".

210.title: Heatwave spell across northwest India ends, Delhi to witness winds: IMD
210.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the major spell of heatwave across northwest India has come to an end. "Due to the increased presence of clouds over Delhi, Punjab, Rajasthan and Haryana, the temperature will decrease by 2-3°C...Delhi will have wind and cloud conditions," an IMD official said. "Heatwave conditions might arise in Rajasthan around April 16," he added.

211.title: Dolphin attacks trainer forcing it to perform in US; PETA shares video
211.article_body: PETA shared a video of a dolphin attacking a trainer after being allegedly forced to perform tricks for the visitors' entertainment at Miami Seaquarium. "This chilling video shows a dolphin attacking a trainer, tossing her body violently through the water, & reportedly sending her to the hospital," tweeted PETA. "Miami Seaquarium must send the animals to seaside sanctuaries," PETA added.

212.title: We gave dharna in Delhi but anti-farmer Centre didn't pay heed: TRS MLC
212.article_body: Telangana produces 40% of India's rice, TRS MLC K Kalvakuntla said on Wednesday. "That's why we're called the rice bowl of India," Kalvakuntla added. "Since production is so high, we require help from the Central government. We gave dharna in Delhi but the corporate-friendly and anti-farmer Central government didn't pay heed to it," Kalvakuntla stated.

213.title: Sri Lanka urges citizens living abroad to send money amid economic crisis
213.article_body: Sri Lanka has urged its citizens living abroad to donate money amid the economic crisis the country is going through. Central bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe asked them to "support the country at this crucial juncture". He said the bank "assures that such foreign currency transfers will be utilised only for importation of essentials, including food, fuel and medicines".

214.title: Superiority of son over father; it's a dream of every dad: Big B on Abhishek
214.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan praised his son, actor Abhishek Bachchan, post the release of his film 'Dasvi'. He said Abhishek has given him "so much pride and joy". Sharing an article on Instagram featuring Abhishek, Amitabh wrote, "Every father's dream...My prayers [are always] with you." He also took to his blog and wrote, "The superiority of...son over the father...Biggest moment of pride."

215.title: Prashanth's concern was my health after cancer, mine was 'Adheera': Sanjay
215.article_body: Sanjay Dutt said he was concerned only about his character 'Adheera' in upcoming film 'K.G.F: Chapter 2', after making a comeback having been diagnosed with cancer during the movie's production. Sanjay added that the film's director Prashanth Neel was concerned about his health. "While the journey has been challenging, I have loved every part of it," stated Sanjay.

216.title: Deutsche Telekom buys $2.4 billion SoftBank stake in T-Mobile
216.article_body: Deutsche Telekom AG has bought SoftBank Group's stake in T-Mobile US for $2.4 billion. It now holds 48.4% of the company. Deutsche Telekom bought 21.2 million shares at an average price of $113 per T-Mobile share. In September last year, SoftBank agreed to swap about 45 million T-Mobile shares for a 4.5% stake in Deutsche Telekom AG.

217.title: 7 sentenced to life over toddler’s kidnapping in 2014 in Mumbai
217.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced seven people to life imprisonment for kidnapping a three-year-old boy and taking a ransom of ₹81 lakh from his father in 2014. They were only arrested a year later for kidnapping a 21-year-old and demanding ₹2 crore ransom. Court held the accused guilty of kidnapping for ransom, extortion, wrongful confinement and criminal conspiracy.

218.title: PMRDA files complaints against 6 builders for selling illegal plots
218.article_body: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) has filed police complaints against six builders for selling illegal plots to people. "Before purchasing...plots in the PMRDA region, citizens must check the legalities instead of blocking their money," an official said. PMRDA also appealed to residents to reach out to the authority if they have information on illegal plotting in the region.

219.title: 3 members of family shot at over pet dog's bark in UP's Ghaziabad
219.article_body: Three members of a family were shot at by a group of men after the victims' pet dog barked at them in UP's Ghaziabad, police said. "All victims suffered gunshot injuries...[were] rushed to Delhi's GTB Hospital," police added. "On Monday night, the dog barked at the suspects again...in a fit of rage, they brought firearms...shot at the victims," police stated.

220.title: 19-yr-old girl caught with pistol in her pocket; video shows UP police recovering it
220.article_body: A 19-year-old girl was caught with a country-made pistol in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri. A video of the incident is being widely circulated online, showing a policewoman recovering the weapon from her pocket. While several reports claimed that the accused was a teacher, Mainpuri Police clarified that she is not a teacher and the case is under investigation.

221.title: Akash Deep will be the trump card for RCB at the backend of IPL 2022: Hogg
221.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg has said RCB pacer Akash Deep will be the franchise's trump card with the ball at the backend of the ongoing IPL season. "Akash, with his extra height and bounce, is going to improve...I like the way he swings the ball away from the left-handers...He'll be the final tick in the box for RCB," added Hogg.

222.title: Journalist arrested in Pune over protests outside Sharad Pawar's home
222.article_body: A journalist has been arrested from Pune in connection with the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's home in Mumbai. A group of MSRTC employees had staged a protest outside Pawar's residence on April 8, accusing him of not doing anything to help them. At least 115 people have been arrested in the matter so far.

223.title: Will not allow imposition of Hindi in Tamil Nadu: BJP's Annamalai
223.article_body: Days after Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark, Tamil Nadu BJP leader K Annamalai said that the state unit of the party will not allow the imposition of Hindi in the state. "If we require for work, education or other purposes, we can learn Hindi but it cannot be imposed. None of us here, including me, speaks Hindi," Annamalai said.

224.title: Asking senior actors to audition is humiliating, really hurts: Sudhaa Chandran
224.article_body: Actress Sudhaa Chandran said asking senior actors like her to audition is humiliating and really hurts, adding that she openly refuses to audition. "If I have to audition then what is my 35 years of input in this industry, and if you don't know my calibre, well I don't want to work with you," stated Sudhaa.

225.title: There's so much fear: Suchitra on her mother comparing actors to prostitutes
225.article_body: Discussing her novel 'Drama Queen' where she mentioned how her mother was against her acting in films and going on to compare actors to prostitutes, Suchitra Krishnamoorthi said there's so much fear about the sexuality, confidence of girls. Suchitra further discussed in the book about her sister being criticised for standing at a bus stop as "only prostitutes loiter there".

226.title: 'Runway 34' shot with 14-15 cameras which nobody in B'wood has done: Ajay
226.article_body: Discussing his upcoming film 'Runway 34', actor Ajay Devgn said the movie had scenes which were shot using 14 to 15 cameras which nobody in Bollywood has done before. "It was pretty tough to shoot. The first decision we took was to make a genuine...cockpit. The size of a cockpit is small. Two people barely fit in," added Ajay.

227.title: Went to 'Donda' premiere having not spoken to Kanye for 8 months: Kim
227.article_body: Talking about her former husband and rapper Kanye West, Kim Kardashian said she attended the premiere of Kanye's album 'Donda', having earlier not spoken to him for eight months at the beginning of their divorce. Kim filed for divorce from Kanye in February 2021. Kanye is reportedly looking for "behavioural treatment" to "be a better human".

228.title: 60 kg fake gold seized in Assam; 1 arrested
228.article_body: Assam Police said they seized 60 kg fake gold from a person driving a four-wheeler vehicle during a security check at NH 15 on Tuesday. The police chased the vehicle and arrested the driver who tried to escape. "The police team chased the vehicle…During the search, we recovered 60 kg of fake gold from the vehicle," said police.

229.title: Anjuman-I-Islam members offer pooja at Dharwad's Hanumantha temple
229.article_body: Members of the educational and social organisation, Anjuman-I-Islam, offered a special pooja at the Sri Nuggikeri Hanumantha temple in Dharwad on Monday. This came after the members of Sri Ram Sene allegedly vandalised at least four fruit carts belonging to Muslim vendors near the temple on Saturday. Karnataka Police have made four arrests in the case so far.

230.title: Johnny Depp smiles as ex-wife's lawyer tells court 'Depp is obsessed with Musk'
230.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp smirked in the court as his ex-wife Amber Heard's lawyer said, "You'll find out that Depp is obsessed with Elon Musk." Actress Amber Heard, who filed for divorce with Depp in 2016, later dated Elon Musk. Depp sued Heard for defamation over her article on domestic violence, claiming that it implied Depp was an "abuser".

231.title: 17 Eklavya schools to be functional in Tripura by 2023-24: Union Minister
231.article_body: Union Minister Bishweswar Tudu on Tuesday said altogether 17 Eklavya Model Residential Schools would be made functional in Tripura by 2023-24 academic session. The state currently has four such educational institutes. "PM Narendra Modi has been laying emphasis on proper education for tribal youths as he believes only better learning can bring a change among them," Tudu added.

232.title: 1 killed as drunk driver rams car into pedestrians in Mumbai
232.article_body: A drunk driver, identified as Mukesh Pradeep Singh, rammed his car into pedestrians near the World Trade Centre in Mumbai's Cuffe Parade on Tuesday afternoon, allegedly killing one senior clerk working with the Navi Mumbai Police Commissionerate. After dropping off his employer, the accused took the car for a joyride, said police. He was arrested soon after the incident.

233.title: Over 42,000 displaced after tropical typhoon hits Philippines
233.article_body: More than 42,000 people have been displaced after Typhoon Megi made landfall on Sunday in the Philippines. Typhoon Megi had triggered landslides in coastal provinces, leaving at least 56 people dead and dozens of others missing. Notably, Megi is the first tropical cyclone to hit the country this year, which sees an average of 20 such storms annually.

234.title: Rohit must forget captaincy when he bats, needs to know he's 'Hitman': Sehwag
234.article_body: Ahead of MI's game against PBKS on Wednesday, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said MI will have to "put extra runs on board" as CSK did against RCB to earn their first win in the ongoing IPL season. "Rohit Sharma will need to forget [captaincy] when he walks out to bat and needs to know that he's the 'Hitman'," added Sehwag.

235.title: Dharavi has recorded no new COVID-19 cases since Mar 24: BMC data
235.article_body: Asia's largest slum Dharavi has recorded no new COVID-19 cases since March 24, data collated by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) showed. With a population of 8.5 lakh residents, Dharavi has recorded 8,652 cases and 419 deaths due to COVID-19 since April 1, 2020. The G/North ward, which covers Dharavi, Dadar and Mahim areas, currently has only one active case.

236.title: Actions by state govts amid incidents of violence 'inappropriate': Mayawati
236.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday said state governments' actions in Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat and Rajasthan amid recent cases of violence were 'inappropriate'. Mayawati tweeted that the incidents disturbed peace and harmony, adding, "The actions initiated by (the state) governments prima facie seem to be revengeful." "Will such examples lead to a new India?" she further wrote.

237.title: Do it like the rich do: dezerv.
237.article_body: Wealthtech firm dezerv. claims to help you invest like the ultra-wealthy have been investing for decades. Their experts aim to curate high-performing portfolios to maximize your wealth. dezerv. also offers its members exclusive access to benefits like pre-IPO deals and plans to offer global equity deals soon. It’s time to use the strategies of the ultra-wealthy for yourself, said dezerv.

238.title: I refused to remove my turban: Minister Puri as he shares 2010 US airport incident
238.article_body: On the occasion of International Turban Day or Sikh Dastar Diwas on Wednesday, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri recalled an old incident at a US airport. "I refused to remove my Dastar (turban) or let anyone touch it at a US airport in 2010 leading to the current practice of self-pat check by Sikhs at international airports," he tweeted.

239.title: PMC begins sealing illegal structures during anti-encroachment drives
239.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has begun sealing illegal structures as it continues conducting anti-encroachment drives in city, PMC's anti-encroachment department head Madhav Jagtap said. "Every day...[anti-encroachment] drive goes on at five to six...locations in different ward offices," he added. Jagtap also appealed to residents to remove encroachments themselves instead of awaiting action.

240.title: Major fire breaks out at BSNL office in Pune, doused in nearly 2 hrs
240.article_body: A major fire broke out on the eight floor of the BSNL office in Pune Cantonment area around 1 am on Tuesday. Tables, chairs, sofas and computers were gutted in the blaze, an official said, adding that firemen had to break open glass window panes to get inside the building. The blaze was doused by 2.30 am.

241.title: Police warn media not to block cars as guests arrive for Ranbir-Alia's mehendi
241.article_body: Mumbai Police officials were seen issuing strict instructions to photographers not to block the cars for photos as guests arrived for Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's mehendi ceremony, reported Times of India. They were asked to wait for whichever star wanted to give them a photo. Ayan Mukerji, Kareena Kapoor and Karisma Kapoor were seen arriving for the ceremony.

242.title: 2 drunk policemen breach IPL bio-bubble to click pictures with players
242.article_body: Two police constables, deputed for security at the DY Patil Stadium, breached the bio-bubble to click pictures with players during the IPL 2022 match between Gujarat Titans and SunRisers Hyderabad. The duo sneaked into the bio-bubble after arguing with the women constables. Both of them have been booked under section 85(1) of Maharashtra Prohibition Act.

243.title: Bharti documents baby's homecoming in a new video; reveals nickname
243.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh, who welcomed a son with her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on April 3, shared a new video about the baby on their YouTube channel Lol (Life of Limbachiyaa's). She also shared a glimpse of the baby's welcome to their home and revealed the nickname she and Haarsh gave him. She said, "We call him Golla because he's golu-molu."

244.title: Mumbai-Ahmedabad Bullet Train project to start operations by 2027
244.article_body: National High Speed Rail Corporation Managing Director Satish Agnihotri said services for the public on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad High Speed Rail corridor will be rolled out in 2027. However, the trial run on the corridor's Gujarat section will begin in 2026. He said the Surat station, which will be one of the largest bullet train stations, will be completed by 2023.

245.title: Viral video shows ground suddenly collapsing with 5 men and a bike falling inside
245.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing the ground suddenly collapsing with five men and a bike falling inside. The incident purportedly happened at a roadside mechanic shop in Rajasthan. Four of the five men were talking to each other, while a mechanic was repairing the bike when the ground suddenly caved in.

246.title: 'Secret weapon' Hasaranga not bowling till 11th over blunder by RCB: Hogg
246.article_body: Discussing RCB's defeat against CSK, ex-KKR spinner Brad Hogg tweeted that RCB made a mistake by not making their "secret weapon" Wanindu Hasaranga bowl his first over till the 11th over. "CSK [were] tactically superior. They bowled seven overs of spin in the first 10 overs compared to three from RCB," added Hogg in his tweet.

247.title: What an incredible answer: Paytm CEO on MEA Jaishankar's remark on Russia
247.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to laud the MEA S Jaishankar for his response to a reporter, who had asked, "Why not condemn Russia's invasion (of Ukraine)?" Jaishankar responded, "I prefer to do it my way and articulate it my way...We've made statements...We're against the conflict." Sharing Jaishankar's response, the Paytm CEO tweeted, "What an incredible answer."

248.title: I really liked it: PM Modi on graph with sound of money transacted via UPI
248.article_body: India in Pixels shared a graph with the sound of money transacted via UPI from October 2016 to March 2022 through data sonification on Twitter. PM Narendra Modi said, "I've spoken about UPI and Digital Payments quite often but I really liked how you've used the sound of money transacted...to effectively convey the point. Very interesting, impressive and obviously informative!"

249.title: Senior BJP leader Harmel Dhiman, 2 others from Himachal join AAP
249.article_body: National Executive Member of BJP and Vice-President of BJP's Himachal Pradesh SC Morcha, Harmel Dhiman on Wednesday joined the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in presence of Satyendar Jain. Along with Dhiman, two other BJP leaders from Himachal Pradesh, Devraj and Jagdish Pawar also joined AAP. "At least 1,000 people from BJP will join AAP soon," Jain said.

250.title: Bird appears to poop on US President Biden during his inflation speech; video viral
250.article_body: A bird appeared to poop on US President Joe Biden's suit as he delivered his speech on inflation and the state of the American economy in Iowa. A video of the incident, which is going viral on social media, shows a white substance falling on him while he was unveiling plans to cut gas prices.

251.title: Case filed against Digvijaya Singh for his tweet on Khargone violence
251.article_body: A case was filed against Congress leader Digvijaya Singh for allegedly spreading religious animosity by tweeting a fake photo related to a violence incident in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone. Singh shared an image of young teenagers waving a saffron flag at a mosque, referring to the violence that erupted during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone. Later, he removed the tweet.

252.title: Caregiver for Sonam's mother-in-law stole ₹2.4 crore cash, jewellery: Police
252.article_body: A caregiver for actress Sonam Kapoor's mother-in-law stole cash and jewellery worth ₹2.4 crore from their Delhi residence. The caregiver and her husband have been arrested by the police over the theft that took place on February 11. The stolen jewellery and cash are yet to be recovered, according to reports.

253.title: Arshad Warsi to undergo surgery for kidney stone; advised complete rest: Reports
253.article_body: Actor Arshad Warsi will reportedly undergo surgery at a hospital in Mumbai on Wednesday. According to reports, Arshad is currently resting in a suburban multi-speciality hospital near his home and will have a kidney stone operation on April 13. He has been advised complete rest, medication and monitored diet and water consumption for the next fortnight, reports added.

254.title: ST panel orders Keonjhar Collector’s arrest for ignoring summons
254.article_body: The National Commission for Scheduled Tribes issued an arrest warrant against Odisha’s Keonjhar district Collector, Ashish Thakare, for "ignoring" summons for a hearing on violations of tribal rights. It has asked state police chief to produce Thakare on Wednesday before the panel as he “absconds and keeps out of the way for purpose of avoiding service of the summons".

255.title: Indian Consulate in Shanghai to be 'inaccessible' due to COVID lockdown
255.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Beijing said Indian Consulate in Shanghai will remain "inaccessible" and will not be in a position to provide in-person consular services amid COVID-19 lockdown in the Chinese city. However, the consulate will remain operational in remote mode. Indians in eastern China have been advised to approach the Embassy of India in Beijing for emergency consular services.

256.title: 1 dead, 6 injured after speeding car hits multiple vehicles in Gr Noida
256.article_body: While one person was killed, six others including a three-year-old kid were injured after a rashly driven cab hit a car followed by a bike in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida. The 32-year-old man, who was riding the bike with his son and wife, succumbed to the injuries. A pedestrian and an ice cream vendor were also injured in the accident.

257.title: Suyash came to bat in a tough situation, looked like he belonged: RCB's Hesson
257.article_body: RCB's Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson praised batter Suyash Prabhudessai for his performance against CSK on Tuesday night. "He came in a tough situation and looked like he belonged. That's what you want to see from these young guys," stated Hesson. Suyash came in to bat when RCB were 50/4 during the seventh over and scored 34 off 18.

258.title: Ex-Zoho staff's startup Securden raises $10.5 mn led by Tiger Global
258.article_body: IT security firm ﻿Securden﻿ has raised $10.5 million in a Series A funding round led by Tiger Global. The investment round has also seen participation from Together Fund and Securden's existing investor, Accel. Founded by former Zoho employees Bala Venkatramani and Kumaran Balan, Securden offers access security and governance platform for IT services, DevOps, and cloud environments.

259.title: Pune's SPPU to schedule papers for students who missed semester exams
259.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has decided to hold papers for students who have missed their semester exams. Students can apply for exams between April 8 and April 18 and colleges have been asked to inward these forms from April 19 to April 20. According to SPPU's examination department, over six lakh students are appearing for the second-semester examination.

260.title: Boat carrying rice bags sinks in Assam's Brahmaputra river
260.article_body: A boat carrying rice bags reportedly sank in the Brahmaputra river after it was caught up in a storm in Assam's Barpeta district on Tuesday. "Passengers were rescued, but the rice bags and other items were damaged," a local said. "We demand from the state government to take necessary steps to construct a bridge connecting Bohori to Kachumara," he added.

261.title: Neetu shares pic from her engagement with Rishi Kapoor ahead of Alia-Ranbir's wedding
261.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture from her engagement with Rishi Kapoor ahead of her son Ranbir Kapoor's wedding with Alia Bhatt. "Fond memories of Baisakhi day...as we got engaged 43 years back on 13th April 1979," Neetu wrote. Neetu and Rishi had got married on January 22, 1980. Rishi passed away aged 67 in 2020.

262.title: Zelenskyy offers to swap captured Putin ally for Ukrainian 'boys & girls'
262.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has proposed swapping captured pro-Russian politician Viktor Medvedchuk, seen as President Vladimir Putin's closest ally in the country, for Ukrainian "boys and girls who're held in Russian captivity". Earlier, Zelenskyy had posted a picture on Facebook of Medvedchuk, who escaped from house arrest after Russia's invasion, in a military uniform and handcuffs.

263.title: Delhi HC grants bail to 8 accused of vandalism outside Kejriwal's home
263.article_body: Delhi High Court granted bail to eight people who were arrested in connection with vandalism and violence outside CM Arvind Kejriwal's home. The evidence collected, so far, is of such nature that they cannot tamper with it, HC stated. "The continued custody of the applicants is not called for only because some investigations are still going on," it added.

264.title: Dhoni helped me improve; asked me to stay still, let the skill work: Dube
264.article_body: Discussing his unbeaten 95 off 46 balls against RCB, CSK all-rounder Shivam Dube said MS Dhoni helped him improve his game, adding that Dhoni asked him to stay still and let his skill work. Dube helped CSK set a target of 217 for RCB. Defending champions CSK beat RCB by 23 runs and recorded their maiden win in IPL 2022.

265.title: You can rape Ukrainian women, just use protection: Russia woman to soldier partner
265.article_body: In a phone call intercepted by Ukrainian security services, a Russian woman is heard telling her soldier partner to rape Ukrainian women amid the war. "Don't tell me anything, understand...Just use protection," the woman said. "Wives of Russian aggressors call on their husbands to rape Ukrainian women," Ukrainian security services wrote along with the audio clip.

266.title: Bundesliga match paused for the first time ever to allow a player to break Ramadan fast
266.article_body: A match between Mainz and Augsburg was paused in the 65th minute, marking the first instance of a Bundesliga match being briefly halted to allow a player to break fast during Ramadan. Referee Matthias Jollenbeck halted proceedings so that Mainz defender Moussa Niakhate ​could hydrate himself. Moussa then thanked the referee for his gesture.

267.title: Mumbai woman falls for 'buy 1 get 2' ad on Facebook, gets cheated of ₹1 lakh
267.article_body: A 59-year-old Mumbai-based woman lost ₹1 lakh after ordering a product after seeing a Facebook ad that read "buy one thali and get two thali free". The woman called on the mobile number mentioned in the advertisement. Later, the fraudster sent her a link asking to share bank details. On sharing the details, the amount was deducted from her account.

268.title: Madrid knock out Chelsea, Villarreal beat Bayern to enter Champions League semis
268.article_body: Real Madrid knocked out Chelsea while Villarreal eliminated Bayern Munich in their respective quarterfinal ties to advance to the Champions League semifinals. Madrid, who had won the first leg 3-1, advanced with a 5-4 aggregate win despite suffering a 2-3 defeat in second leg. Villarreal earned a 1-1 draw in the second leg after having won the first leg 1-0.

269.title: PM Modi pays tribute to the martyrs of Jallianwala Bagh massacre
269.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to the people martyred in the Jallianwala Bagh massacre in 1919. "Their unparalleled courage and sacrifice will keep motivating the coming generations," he tweeted on Wednesday. Hundreds of people who had gathered at the Jallianwala Bagh to protest peacefully against the Rowlatt Act were gunned down by the British forces on April 13, 1919.

270.title: Mumbai man creates 11 fake profiles to sexually harass wife over triple talaq FIR
270.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly creating 11 fake profiles on Instagram to sexually harass his wife after she lodged an FIR against him for giving her triple talaq last year. The 30-year-old complainant told the police that she started getting sexually explicit messages from unknown Instagram accounts on her and her daughter's Instagram handle.

271.title: Kapiva claims their Get Slim Juice is deemed effective on 90% of users
271.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda shared in a study conducted amongst its Get Slim Juice consumers that 90% of users claimed it helped in weight loss, reduced cravings, and improved energy levels. Kapiva claims that it has 12 ayurvedic herbs which effectively boost metabolism and reduce fat accumulation and sugar absorption. Kapiva also provided doctor guidance to consumers to manage weight.

272.title: BJP chief JP Nadda forms team to look into Hanskhali rape-murder
272.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda has reportedly formed a five-member committee to look into the alleged gangrape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in West Bengal's Hanskhali. The committee, which includes MP Rekha Verma and UP minister Baby Rani Maurya, has been asked to submit its report at the earliest. Earlier, the Calcutta High Court ordered CBI to investigate the case.

273.title: Sex with minor is rape: Mahua Moitra after Mamata Banerjee's 'love affair' remark
273.article_body: Speaking on the alleged rape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in West Bengal, TMC MP Mahua Moitra said sex with a minor is rape and a crime. She said, "I won't tolerate such things." This comes after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's remark, "How do you know if she was raped or was pregnant or had a love affair?"

274.title: Sikh youth attacks 2 with kirpan at Delhi's Kamla Nagar Market, 1 dies
274.article_body: A Sikh youth, identified as Gurpreet Singh, attacked two persons with a kirpan at Delhi's Kamla Nagar Market area on Tuesday, police said. One of the victims died on the spot, while the other faced serious injuries, police added. Singh reached the area to acquire money from one of the victims following which a fight broke out between the two.

275.title: Uber halts surge pricing following Brooklyn shooting after criticism
275.article_body: Uber and Lyft halted surge pricing in the Sunset Park area of Brooklyn after their algorithms increased fares in the wake of a shooting on April 12. Ride fares increased on the apps after emergency alerts advised people to avoid the area near the 36th Street subway station. The firms faced criticism online for the surge pricing on apps.

276.title: Don't give Raj Thackeray so much importance: Ajit Pawar amid Azaan row
276.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said he will soon reply to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's warning about removal of loudspeakers from mosques. "Raj Thackeray must not be given so much importance, when...right time comes, I'll surely answer on it," Pawar said on Wednesday. Thackeray warned against statewide protests if the government fails to remove loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

277.title: I resented playing 'Arya Stark' in 'Game of Thrones': Maisie Williams
277.article_body: Actress Maisie Williams, who portrayed the character of 'Arya Stark' in television series 'Game of Thrones', said she resented playing 'Arya', as she couldn't express who she was becoming when she started becoming a woman. "I also resented my body because it wasn't aligned with the piece of me that the world celebrated," added Maisie.

278.title: Alia-Ranbir's wedding happening on April 14, definitely not on April 20: Robin Bhatt
278.article_body: Talking about Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding, Alia's uncle Robin Bhatt said, "As far as I know...their wedding is happening on April 14 as scheduled. It’s definitely not on April 20." He stated, "I don’t know why it’s being done quietly. It was Ranbir and Alia’s call. It’s an unusual marriage because the children are taking all the decisions."

279.title: IPO-bound Pine Labs makes majority investment in Mosambee
279.article_body: IPO-bound Pine Labs has made a significant majority investment into payments solution provider Mosambee. With the investment by Pine Labs, Mosambee is now valued at upwards of $100 million, the company said. The leadership team at Mosambee will continue to operate independently. Pine Labs had raised $50 million from London-based international investment firm Vitruvian Partners in March.

280.title: Karthik really struggled at KKR: Ex-Team India manager Lalchand Rajput
280.article_body: Ex-Team India manager Lalchand Rajput said RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik really struggled while representing KKR and could not execute his skills. "Karthik is surely the best finisher...[currently]," added Rajput. Karthik has scored 131 runs in five IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 218.33 and average of 131. Karthik is RCB's second-highest run-scorer in IPL 2022.

281.title: CGST team raids gutkha trader's house in Himachal, recovers crores in cash
281.article_body: A Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) department team from UP's Kanpur raided the house of a gutkha trader in Sumerpur in Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur on Tuesday and recovered crores in cash and gold. The team also brought three note-counting machines from SBI bank. The CGST team seized all the documents, bank accounts and laptops of the trader.

282.title: 2 Sikh men attacked in US, their turbans removed as video shows 1 man bleeding
282.article_body: A person has been arrested after two Sikh men were attacked in Richmond Hill, New York. A video on social media showed the two men without turbans, with one of them seen bleeding. The attack reportedly took place at the same location where a 70-year-old Sikh man was attacked and was left with a broken nose.

283.title: 7 get life term for kidnapping 3-yr-old, taking ₹81 lakh ransom in Maha
283.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced seven people, including a woman, to life imprisonment for kidnapping a three-year-old boy and taking a ransom of ₹81 lakh from his father in 2014. Court held the accused guilty of kidnapping for ransom, extortion, wrongful confinement and criminal conspiracy. They had remained untraced until they were nabbed in another kidnapping case in 2015.

284.title: I cannot imagine any other Indian actor in Bheem's role: Rajamouli on Jr NTR
284.article_body: When asked if Ram Charan stole the limelight in 'RRR', filmmaker SS Rajamouli said that Ram Charan and Jr NTR justified their respective roles equally. "It breaks my heart to think of crediting one of them for the movie's success," Rajamouli said. "I cannot imagine any other Indian actor in Bheem's role, because it has a multilayered idiosyncrasy," he added.

285.title: Pandemic isn’t over yet, haven’t let guard down: Mansukh Mandaviya
285.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said that the government has not let the guard down and it is continuing tracing, surveillance and genome mapping to see if there’s any new COVID-19 variant. He urged the people to continue with precautions as the pandemic is not over yet. "We cannot predict tomorrow," Mandaviya stated.

286.title: Varavara Rao denied permanent bail, interim relief extended
286.article_body: Poet and activist Varavara Rao, accused in the Elgar Parishad case, was denied a permanent medical bail by the Bombay High Court. The court, however, extended his interim bail by three months to allow him to undergo cataract surgery. Citing his medical condition and high expenses in Mumbai, Rao had sought permission to move to his residence in Hyderabad.

287.title: Flesh trade racket busted in Himachal's Kangra, 5 women rescued
287.article_body: Himachal Pradesh police busted a flesh trade racket and rescued five women allegedly held captive at a private hotel in Kangra's Damtal. The hotel owner and his two sons were also arrested by the police. The police busted the racket after receiving a call from parents of a 27-year-old woman who alleged to have been locked in the hotel room.

288.title: I stand by what I did: De Kock on refusing to take a knee in T20 WC 2021
288.article_body: Talking about refusing to take a knee for 'Black Lives Matter' movement in T20 World Cup 2021, South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Quinton De Kock said he stands by what he did. "[Cricket South Africa] could've done things differently, not just smack dab in the middle of a World Cup...before a game. The pressure was thrown onto the players," added De Kock.

289.title: Centre negating federalism: AAP to SC in plea for control over services in Delhi
289.article_body: The Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government told Supreme Court that Centre has been "negating federalism" by taking away its power. A "democratically elected government" should not be left without powers to even transfer officials, the party said. The statement was made while the apex court was hearing case between Centre and AAP on issue over the bureaucracy in the national capital.

290.title: I've learnt a lot from RCB seniors: Suyash Prabhudessai on 34(18) vs CSK
290.article_body: Speaking at the post-match conference, RCB's 24-year-old batter Suyash Prabhudessai, who made his IPL debut against CSK and scored 34(18), said he has learnt a lot from seniors at the franchise. "I keep interacting with Virat (Kohli) bhai, DK (Dinesh Karthik)...My intent is very clear when I get out to bat, and I back my strengths," he added.

291.title: Ashneer Grover row is an aberration: BharatPe Chairman Kumar
291.article_body: BharatPe Chairman Rajnish Kumar in an interview with CNBC-TV18 said the Ashneer Grover controversy of BharatPe is an "aberration". "The startup universe is very different. When it is in a growth phase, it is possible that the kind of governance which is expected is not there...The media should not pay so much attention to BharatPe," Kumar said.

292.title: 28 hospitalised after consuming sedative-laced drink at Gurugram fair
292.article_body: At least 28 people, including children, were hospitalised after allegedly consuming a sedative-laced drink at a fair in Mubarikpur village in Haryana's Gurugram on Tuesday, police said. The accused offered people the drink claiming it is 'prasad', police added. "The suspect offered them 'Frooty' which was allegedly laced with some intoxicant...28 were taken to civil hospital," police stated.

293.title: Bengaluru man accused of raping, killing 2-year-old ends life in prison
293.article_body: A 31-year-old Bengaluru man, who was on undertrial for being accused of raping, killing his 2-year-old niece, ended life inside Karnataka's Central Jail at Parappana Agrahara. The man was reportedly found dead in bathroom and a blanket was found around his neck, which was tied to window grill. The man was a truck driver and father of two young girls.

294.title: Excise department clerk arrested for taking ₹5,000 bribe in Pune
294.article_body: A 45-year-old state excise department clerk in Pune has been arrested by the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹5,000 from a businessman seeking a liquor licence for a permit room. The businessman had approached the Anti-Corruption Bureau after the clerk demanded the bribe. Following this, ACB laid a trap and arrested the accused.

295.title: 90 SpiceJet pilots barred from flying Boeing 737 Max, will undergo re-training: DGCA
295.article_body: Indian aviation regulator DGCA has barred 90 SpiceJet pilots from operating Boeing 737 Max aircraft after finding them not properly trained. "They will have to undergo training again," said DGCA Director-General Arun Kumar. SpiceJet said the restriction does not impact the operations of Max aircraft as it still has 560 trained pilots for its fleet of 11 Max aircraft.

296.title: University of Hyderabad orders inquiry after Ram temple built on campus
296.article_body: University of Hyderabad ordered an inquiry after a Ram temple was allegedly built on the campus on the occasion of Ram Navami. It was Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad activists who painted a rock structure and installed photos of Lord Ram and flags, the students' union alleged. "It's a small structure that has existed since the university's inception," the registrar said.

297.title: Germany may snub PM Modi as G-7 guest over India's Russia stand: Report
297.article_body: Germany is debating whether to invite PM Narendra Modi to G-7 summit over India's stand on Russia's war in Ukraine, according to a report quoting people familiar with the matter. One of the people said India had been on a list drawn up before the war in Ukraine started. Recently, India abstained from a vote to suspend Russia from UNHRC.

298.title: Actor Gottfried, voice of Iago in 'Aladdin', dies at 67 due to ventricular tachycardia
298.article_body: Actor-comedian Gilbert Gottfried, who is known for voicing Iago in Disney's animated film 'Aladdin', passed away aged 67 due to ventricular tachycardia. Gottfried started performing stand-up comedy aged 15. He was a cast member on 'Saturday Night Live' during the 1980-81 season. Gottfried is survived by his wife and their two children, 14-year-old daughter Lily and 12-year-old son Max.

299.title: Mohammed Siraj pulls off Dhoni-like helicopter shot in front of Dhoni, video goes viral
299.article_body: RCB fast bowler Mohammed Siraj pulled off an MS Dhoni-like helicopter shot in front of the CSK wicketkeeper during their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. Playing the last ball of the match, Siraj executed the helicopter shot and scored a boundary on the bowling of Dwayne Bravo. Siraj scored an unbeaten 14 off 11 deliveries in the match.

300.title: Agra Police arrests man wanted for firing at girl in her house
300.article_body: The Agra Police arrested a man, who was wanted for attacking a girl inside her house on April 1 after she rejected his marriage proposal. "He struck the girl on her head and then fired twice at her. One of the bullets struck the stomach of the girl...She has recovered now," a police official said.

301.title: I'm so happy Ranbir & Alia are together; they are very similar: Imtiaz
301.article_body: When asked about actors Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, filmmaker Imtiaz Ali said, "Amongst the actors that I've worked with, there's no one more similar than Ranbir and Alia. To be alike as actors, you have to be alike as people as well." "The fact that Ranbir and Alia are together, gives me immense happiness and pleasure," he added.

302.title: Dhananjay Munde hospitalised, Ajit Pawar says he didn't have 'minor attack'
302.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar met state's Social Justice Minister Dhananjay Munde, who was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai on Tuesday. Contrary to reports of Munde suffering a stroke, Pawar said, "There's no need to worry. He didn't have a minor attack." He further said that Munde fainted as he became unconscious and was immediately taken to hospital.

303.title: One of the world’s largest hacker forums taken down in global operation
303.article_body: Law enforcement in Europe and US on Tuesday announced the takedown and seizure of an illegal online market that bought and sold access to databases of millions of credit card numbers and other sensitive information belonging to people around the world. The alleged administrator of RaidForums and two other people were arrested in the global operation dubbed Tourniquet.

304.title: Viagra pills, inflatable penis implants purchased by Brazil military for soldiers
304.article_body: The Brazilian military purchased 35,000 Viagra pills and inflatable penis implants for soldiers, according to Congressman Elias Vaz, who said he had been informed through a freedom of information request. The Brazil Defence Ministry said in a statement the pills were in fact "to treat patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension," or high blood pressure in the lungs.

305.title: Impossible to isolate a vast country as Russia: Putin
305.article_body: Russia doesn't intend to be isolated and that doing so would be impossible, said President Vladimir Putin during his visit to Vostochny Cosmodrome spaceport. "It is impossible to severely isolate anyone in the modern world, especially such a vast country as Russia," said Putin. "We will work with those of our partners who want to cooperate," he added.

306.title: Loudspeakers at mosques should be shut by May 3: Raj Thackeray
306.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday reiterated his call to remove loudspeakers at mosques. "Loudspeakers at mosques should be shut by May 3rd otherwise, we will play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers," Thackeray added. "I want to tell the state government, we will not go back on this subject, do whatever you want to do," Thackeray stated.

307.title: Bihar govt to auction all unused bridges after 60-foot bridge stolen in Rohtas
307.article_body: Bihar government has decided to identify and auction all unused iron bridges as scrap. Commenting on the estimated number of unused bridges, Bihar Water Resources Minister Sanjay Kumar Jha said, "Our engineers are assessing it." This comes days after thieves, posing as officers of the State Irrigation Department, dismantled and stole a 60-foot iron bridge in Rohtas district.

308.title: Millions of lives at stake: UN warns of famine in Somalia
308.article_body: In a joint statement, multiple UN agencies on Tuesday warned of an impending famine owing to prolonged drought in Somalia that could impact millions. "We are literally about to start taking food from the hungry to feed the starving," said an official of UN World Food Programme. "Millions of lives are at stake," added the official.

309.title: Pollard still adds value, I even felt Rohit might give captaincy to him: Manjrekar
309.article_body: Talking about Kieron Pollard's form in the ongoing IPL season, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said the 34-year-old all-rounder still adds value to MI. "I even felt Rohit Sharma might leave captaincy like Virat Kohli, relax a bit...hand the responsibility to Pollard who is a brilliant international captain," Manjrekar added. Pollard has scored 47 runs in his four innings this season.

310.title: Lmao: Hailey on a video claiming there's trouble in her marriage with Justin
310.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber reacted to the rumours saying there's trouble in her marriage with her husband, singer Justin Bieber. Recently, A TikTok video made some predictions about celebrities and among them, there was a claim that things "may be on rocks" with couple Justin Bieber and Hailey. Reacting to the video, Hailey just laughed off the rumours and commented, "Lmaooo."

311.title: No place for riots, chaos in UP: Adityanath on Ram Navami celebration
311.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that the state had set an example on Ram Navami by demonstrating that "there is no place for riots and chaos" in UP. "Forget about riots and ruckus, there was not even any tu-tu main (argument) during the celebration," he added.  "This is a proof of UP's new progressive way of thinking," Adityanath further said.

312.title: Centre to provide 1.5 lakh free Doordarshan Dish TV services in J&K
312.article_body: The Centre has decided to provide 1.5 lakh free Doordarshan Dish TV services to residents living in areas of Jammu and Kashmir where cable service is not available, the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting said. "The tendering for that is under process...will be completed soon," it added. The Information and Broadcasting Secretary Apurva Chandra was on a visit to J&K.

313.title: Gurugram reports over 100 new COVID-19 cases in single day after a month
313.article_body: Gurugram on Tuesday reported 129 new COVID-19 cases, crossing 100 cases in a single day after over a month, health officials said. Notably, the district had last reported more than 100 cases on March 4, with 115 cases recorded on the day. According to the health department, Gurugram's positivity rate now stands at 8.5% with 384 active COVID-19 cases.

314.title: Pune hospital's licence to perform organ transplants suspended for 6 months
314.article_body: The state health department has suspended the licence of Pune's Ruby Hall Clinic to perform organ transplants for six months. The suspension came after alleged malpractice wherein a woman posing as the wife of a man, who needed a transplant, donated her kidney to a young woman patient. In turn, the young woman's mother donated her kidney to the man.

315.title: Russia war a genocide, trying to wipe out Ukraine: US Prez Biden
315.article_body: US President Joe Biden, for the first time, on Tuesday said that Russia's invasion of Ukraine amounts to "genocide". "Yes, I called it genocide because it has become clearer and clearer that [Russian President] Vladimir Putin is just trying to wipe out the idea of being able to be Ukrainian and the evidence is mounting," Biden added.

316.title: Man arrested for delivering liquor in LPG cylinder in Bihar's Patna
316.article_body: A man was arrested for delivering liquor in an LPG cylinder in Bihar's Patna, officials said on Tuesday. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided the spot near Kadam Ghat and arrested the accused, identified as Bhushan Rai. Police also seized about 50 litres of liquor stored inside the cylinder by cutting its base part into a square shape.

317.title: Gal Gadot, Justin Bieber, Bruce Willis invest in crypto firm MoonPay
317.article_body: Cryptocurrency payments startup MoonPay has raised $87 million from over 60 investors including Justin Bieber, tennis player Maria Sharapova, Bruce Willis and Gal Gadot. The investments are part of the firm's Series A round, disclosed in November last year, which valued the company at $3.4 billion. Over 600 crypto startups have reportedly seen over $12.5 billion in funding this year.

318.title: Special survey conducted in Ambala to check crimes, anti-social activities
318.article_body: The Ambala Police conducted a special survey in Deha Colony from 5 am to 7 am on Tuesday, to identify people indulging in anti-social activities, check crimes and maintain law and order in the area. The survey was conducted under the orders of the Additional Director General of Police (ADGP), Ambala, Shrikant Jadhav.

319.title: Woman held for manhandling security officer to meet Haryana CIC
319.article_body: A woman was arrested after she forcibly tried to enter the office of the Haryana Chief Information Commissioner (CIC), Vijai Vardhan, in Chandigarh’s Sector 8-C by manhandling his personal security officer. According to the police, the woman insisted on meeting Vardhan. She was unable to present any ID proof and on being stopped she manhandled the security officer.

320.title: Don't want to step out, I need Sahab so desperately in my life: Saira Banu on Dilip Kumar
320.article_body: Talking about being "extremely distressed" after the death of her husband, actor Dilip Kumar, veteran actress Saira Banu said, "I cannot get out of the loss." She added, "I don't want to step out....I need Sahab so desperately in my life." She further said, "I am not mingling with people. Maybe only with my immediate friends."

321.title: Man suspected to have shot dead 21-year-old Indian student Kartik in Canada arrested
321.article_body: A 39-year-old man, who is believed to have shot and killed 21-year-old Indian student Kartik Vasudev in Canada, has been arrested. Police identified the suspect as Richard Jonathan Edwin, who was charged with another murder on Saturday. Vasudev's father expressed concern over the motive of the killing not being known and said he would travel to Canada for legal proceedings.

322.title: Russia to launch lunar probe with Belarus this year: Putin
322.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said Russia will launch a space probe with Belarus later this year and deepen cooperation on space infrastructure and technology. Russia will launch a probe called Luna-25 to the Moon in the third quarter of this year, he said. Putin has also asked Russia's Roscosmos to train a Belarusian for flight on a Russian spacecraft.

323.title: States must carry out safety audit of ropeways: MHA after Jharkhand accident
323.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) on Tuesday issued an advisory to the states directing them to prepare maintenance manual for ropeway projects in wake of Jharkhand's ropeway accident in which three people were killed. "The state government must engage an experienced and qualified firm or organisation for carrying out safety audit of each ropeway project," the advisory read.

324.title: UK PM Boris Johnson pays fine, apologises for ‘partygate’
324.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson said he had paid the fine imposed on him in what has been called as the "partygate" scandal, for breaching COVID-19 guidelines. "I have paid the fine and I once again offer a full apology," he said. Johnson had attended his birthday party at Downing Street in June 2020, violating COVID-19 curbs.

325.title: Hindu temple destroyed in South Africa flood
325.article_body: A Hindu temple, estimated to be around 70 years old, was destroyed in South Africa's Durban due to severe flood situation in the city that has left at least 45 people dead. "The deities in our Vishnu temple are still there but in the mother temple, everything is gone," said an official of the temple committee.

326.title: Ukrainian politician who says Putin is godfather to his daughter arrested
326.article_body: Ukraine has said it has arrested pro-Russian politician Viktor Medvedchuk, seen as President Vladimir Putin's closest ally in the country. Medvedchuk, who says President Putin is godfather to his daughter, had been under house arrest in the capital Kyiv on suspicion of treason. He escaped soon after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

327.title: Gold worth ₹26 lakh seized from man's trousers & underwear at B'luru airport
327.article_body: The customs officials at the Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru detected and seized 541.3 grams of gold worth around ₹26.7 lakh from a male passenger. The passenger, wearing trousers and briefs stitched with gold paste bands, had arrived at the airport from Dubai on April 7. The accused has been booked for smuggling and customs duty invasion.

328.title: Legendary: Samantha Prabhu compliments Rihanna's Vogue pregnancy shoot
328.article_body: Samantha Prabhu complimented singer Rihanna's pregnancy shoot. Taking to Instagram, Samantha shared a clip from Rihanna's pregnancy photoshoot for Vogue where she is seen donning several outfits as she poses for the camera. Sharing the post, Samantha wrote, "Legendary." Speaking with Vogue, Rihanna had said, "I'm hoping...we were able to redefine what's considered 'decent' for pregnant women."

329.title: Toxic heavy metals found in groundwater in Delhi: Survey
329.article_body: Heavy metals like manganese, iron and uranium, beyond their permissible limits, have been found in groundwater of some areas in Delhi, including Najafgarh, Nangli Rajpura, Bhalswa, Ujwa etc. Drinking this water, in the long run, can lead to chronic toxicity, impacting kidneys or intestines, experts warned. Using this water occasionally for bathing is, however, largely harmless, the experts added.

330.title: Unfortunate: NCW Chairperson on Mamata's remark on Nadia rape case
330.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) Chairperson Rekha Sharma criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for her "rape or love affair" comment on the alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia. "Her statement over the incident is very unfortunate. Being a woman, she should understand the pain of another woman. She pointed fingers at the victim," Sharma said.

331.title: Musk sued by Twitter investor over delay in disclosing Twitter stake
331.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has been sued by a Twitter investor who claims Musk's delay in disclosing his ownership of over 5% of Twitter artificially kept its share price down. The delay allowed Musk to buy more shares at a lower price, the suit alleges. Musk was required to disclose his then 5% stake by March 24.

332.title: AAP lacks leadership, I do not see it as threat to BJP: Himachal Pradesh CM
332.article_body: Ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, CM Jairam Thakur said he does not see AAP as a threat to BJP because it neither has leadership nor organisational network on the ground. "They benefitted from Punjab’s political circumstances…Himachal is a different ballgame. Here, the basic character of politics has long been dominated by two parties, BJP and Congress," Thakur added.

333.title: Gunshots fired at liquor businessman's residence in Gurugram's Pataudi
333.article_body: Multiple gunshots were allegedly fired by unidentified assailants at a liquor businessman's residence in Gurugram's Pataudi on Tuesday, police said. The complainant alleged he received a call from an international number and later a voice message, in which they threatened him and demanded a 50% share in his business. Notably, the complainant is the chairman of the Pataudi Municipal Committee.

334.title: I felt it was time to take him on: Uthappa on smashing Maxwell for 18 runs
334.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa, who scored 88 runs off 50 balls against RCB, has said that when all-rounder Glenn Maxwell was bowling his third over in the game he felt it was time to take him on. Uthappa smashed three sixes in that over, with Shivam Dube taking a single. Maxwell had conceded 10 runs in his first two overs.

335.title: Andrew McDonald appointed Australia head coach on four-year deal
335.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Andrew McDonald has been appointed head coach of the Australia's men's team on a four-year deal. McDonald had been the team's assistant coach since 2019. After former head coach Justin Langer's departure on February 5, McDonald was elevated to the position of interim coach while Cricket Australia searched for a suitable full-time candidate.

336.title: Brazil military bought Viagra pills, inflatable penis implants for soldiers
336.article_body: The Brazilian military purchased Viagra pills and inflatable penis implants for soldiers, according to Congressman Elias Vaz, who said he had been informed through a freedom of information request. The Brazil Defence Ministry said in a statement the pills were in fact "to treat patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension," or high blood pressure in the lungs.

337.title: Dhoni skips celebration to console Mukesh for dropping catches, fans react
337.article_body: After CSK dismissed RCB's Shahbaz Ahmed in the 15th over, CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni skipped the celebration to console 25-year-old Mukesh Choudhary for dropping two catches in the 12th and 15th over, respectively. "Top leadership quality," a fan commented. "Great to see Dhoni put an arm around Mukesh after that wicket," wrote another. CSK defeated RCB by 23 runs.

338.title: 1,088 new COVID-19 cases, 26 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours
338.article_body: India has reported 1,088 new COVID-19 cases, 1,081 recoveries and 26 more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 796 COVID-19 cases and 19 deaths. India's active caseload currently stands at 10,870, while the death toll reached 5,21,736.

339.title: Jadeja lies on the ground after taking Karthik's catch, celebration goes viral
339.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja's celebration after taking RCB's Dinesh Karthik's catch near the boundary rope has gone viral. Jadeja intentionally fell on the ground and lied on it to celebrate the wicket. Karthik was dismissed for 34(14) on the bowling of Dwayne Bravo in the 18th over. Reacting to Jadeja's celebration, a fan tweeted, "What a relief."

340.title: Pune woman kills 2 stray dogs after her son gets bitten by one of them
340.article_body: Police have booked a woman for allegedly killing two stray dogs in a residential society in Pune's Hadapsar after one of the dogs reportedly bit her son. The woman allegedly beat the dogs to death with a stick between the night of April 8 and the morning of April 9. "The body of one dog has been found," police said.

341.title: FIR against K'taka Minister KS Eshwarappa, 2 aides in contractor death case
341.article_body: An FIR has been registered against BJP leader and Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa and two of his aides after contractor Santosh Patil, who had accused the minister of corruption, died by suicide. "Udupi Police registered the FIR on the basis of a complaint filed last night by the contractor's family...minister has been booked...for abetment to suicide," a police official said.

342.title: Journalists critical of Indian govt were physically harassed by officials: US report
342.article_body: The 2021 Country Report on Human Rights Practices released by the US State Department has said that government officials at both the local and national levels in India were involved in "intimidating" critical media outlets through physical harassment and attacks. NGOs in India alleged criminal prosecutions and investigations were used to intimidate journalists critical of the government, it added.

343.title: If I feel I can hit, I'm hitting that delivery: Shivam Dube on his form in IPL 2022
343.article_body: CSK all-rounder Shivam Dube, who has become the second-highest scorer in the ongoing IPL season, has said he's only trying to play his natural game. "The ball I feel I can hit, I'm hitting that delivery...Whatever I was trying to do for a long time, I'm...able to execute that now," he stated. Dube scored 95* off 46 balls against RCB.

344.title: HC orders CBI probe into minor’s rape-murder in Bengal's Hanskhali
344.article_body: The Calcutta High Court has ordered the CBI to take over the investigation into the alleged gangrape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in West Bengal's Hanskhali. The court told the agency to submit a status report by May 2 when the case will be heard next. Notably, CM Mamata Banerjee had accused the Opposition of politicising the incident.

345.title: No NOC needed from housing society to sell or rent flat in Mumbai: Maha Min
345.article_body: Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad said that no prior permission from housing society will be needed by owner to sell or rent out their flat in Mumbai. Mumbai is a cosmopolitan city and if a flat owner is not allowed to sell or rent their flat to a particular caste, creed and religion, it would hurt city's image, Awhad said.

346.title: House made under PM Awas Yojana among those demolished in Khargone
346.article_body: A house reportedly built under the PM Awas Yojana was reduced to rubble during the MP government's demolition drive in Khargone following communal clashes. The documents the Muslim family showed to prove ownership included a property tax receipt and a letter from CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan congratulating them on being a beneficiary of the PM's housing scheme.

347.title: Tears were rolling down my face: Jennifer Lopez on her engagement with Ben
347.article_body: Speaking about her engagement with Ben Affleck, singer Jennifer Lopez said they got a second chance at love. "[I]...looked in his eyes smiling and crying at the same time trying...to get my head around the fact that after 20 years this was happening all over again," she added. "Tears were coming down my face, [I was] feeling...incredibly happy," Jennifer said.

348.title: YouTube services restored after global outage
348.article_body: YouTube said it has fixed issues that disrupted users' ability to log in and switch accounts, among other things, globally, adding that the services are now back online. Logging in, switching accounts and using the navigation bar were among the issues faced by users. Users had also reported issues with accessing the live television platform YouTube TV, according to Downdetector.

349.title: More than 150 vendors fined for violating anti-tobacco rules in Noida
349.article_body: The District Tobacco Control Cell (DTCC) fined 153 vendors on Tuesday for violating Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (Cotpa), 2003 in Noida.
