The fines were issued in Sector 125-126 where one private university and three private schools are located. Few students aged above 18 years were also fined for smoking in public, Dr Shweta Khurana, District Consultant (DTCC) said.

350.title: Fire breaks out in the forest area of Andhra Pradesh's Tirumala
350.article_body: A fire broke out in the forest region of Andhra Pradesh's Tirumala around 2:30 pm on Tuesday, fire officials confirmed. "Fire spread rapidly in the forest area near Elephant Arch on First Ghat Road," an official said. "Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) forest department personnel reached the spot and it took around 8 hours to douse the fire," he added.

351.title: BJP MLA booked for 'provocative speech' during Ram Navami in Hyderabad
351.article_body: Hyderabad Police booked BJP MLA from Goshamahal T Raja Singh for allegedly making a "provocative speech" during a Ram Navami procession. During the rally, Singh purportedly said UP CM Yogi Adityanath will use a bulldozer to clean the country. "The speech and the song...had contents that could likely create enmity between different religious communities," ACP (Goshamahal) R Sathish Kumar said.

352.title: Harshal has ability to stop the game, we missed that vs CSK: Plessis
352.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis said that they missed pacer Harshal Patel in their match against CSK on Tuesday night. "Harshal has got the ability to really stop the game. We missed that...Even towards the end, we lacked variety. Big miss for us," he stated. Harshal left the IPL bio-bubble on Sunday following the death of his sister.

353.title: Over 21 kg of marijuana worth ₹10 lakh seized in Bengaluru, 2 held
353.article_body: Police have arrested two drug peddlers in Bengaluru and seized 21.35 kg of marijuana worth ₹10 lakh from them. The men, both aged 22, were reportedly waiting on a scooter for their clients to deliver the narcotic when the police confronted them. The accused confessed to the police that they procured the drugs from their contacts in Andhra Pradesh.

354.title: Students can now pursue 2 full-time degrees at the same time
354.article_body: The UGC has announced that students will now be able to pursue two full-time academic programmes. Students will be able to pursue two UG or PG degrees/diplomas together in the physical+physical mode or physical+online mode or online+online mode. MPhil and PhD programmes will not fall under the same scheme.

355.title: It's my 1st ever victory as captain, I dedicate it to my wife: Jadeja on win vs RCB
355.article_body: After CSK defeated RCB to register their first win in IPL 2022, CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said, "It is my first ever victory as captain, I would like to dedicate it to my wife because first victory is always special." He added, "CSK management doesn't put pressure on me, they are relaxed, they always come to me and motivate me."

356.title: Woman's 'Not getting married till RCB wins IPL trophy' poster goes viral
356.article_body: A picture of a woman carrying 'Not getting married till RCB wins IPL trophy' poster during Royal Challengers Bangalore-Chennai Super Kings IPL 2022 match has gone viral. Reacting to the picture, a fan commented, "I really hope this is the year for you." RCB have finished as runners-up in IPL three times (2009, 2011 and 2016).

357.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Kathputli Colony, 30 shanties gutted
357.article_body: At least 30 shanties were gutted after a fire broke out at a transit camp in Delhi's Kathputli Colony on Tuesday afternoon. "We got information about the fire at 2.12 pm. It started at the transit camp in Anand Parbat's Kathputli Colony...operation to control the blaze ended at 4 pm," an official said. No casualties were reported in the incident.

358.title: Person of interest identified in US subway train attack, pics released
358.article_body: New York police say they have identified a person of interest in the Brooklyn subway train attack that left more than 20 people injured. Police said they were looking for Frank R James, 62, in connection with the attack. Being identified as a person of interest means police believe he may have information concerning the crime.

359.title: Drinking water for all in Mumbai from May 1: Aaditya Thackeray
359.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Tuesday said every resident of Mumbai, including those living in slums or buildings without an occupation certificate (OC), will have access to drinking water from May 1. Thackeray said this wouldn't change the legal status of a house. "This will also eradicate the illegal connections that disrupt and pollute our water supply," he added.

360.title: Defending champs CSK record their 1st win in IPL 2022, end RCB's 3-match winning streak
360.article_body: Defending champions CSK defeated RCB by 23 runs to record their first win in IPL 2022 after having lost four matches in a row. With the win, CSK ended RCB's three-match winning streak. The match witnessed CSK record the highest total (216/4) in IPL 2022 so far. RCB were restricted to 193/9 in their 20 overs.

361.title: World Bank is preparing $1.5 bn aid package for Ukraine: Official
361.article_body: The World Bank is preparing a nearly $1.5 billion aid package for Ukraine to support the continuation of essential government services, its President David Malpass said. The World Bank is also planning to provide aid to developing countries struggling to keep up with surging food and energy prices, he added. The spike in food prices needs immediate attention, he claimed.

362.title: Davidovich Fokina beats world no. 1 Djokovic at Monte Carlo Masters
362.article_body: Alejandro Davidovich Fokina on Tuesday beat world number one Novak Djokovic 6-3, 6-7(5), 6-1 in the second round of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. The defeat is Djokovic's first loss in the opening match of a tournament since the Barcelona Open in 2018. Davidovich Fokina will face either Daniel Evans or David Goffin in the third round.

363.title: Wanindu Hasaranga is a trump card for RCB: Lalchand Rajput
363.article_body: Calling Wanindu Hasaranga a "smart bowler", ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput said the spinner is a "trump card" for RCB. "He...is very shrewd and...not afraid of getting hit. If you look at his bowling, he always tries to buy wickets, which is...skill of a leg-spinner," he added. With ten wickets from five matches, Hasaranga is currently the leading wicket-taker for RCB.

364.title: 18-year-old accepted into 27 colleges in US, offered scholarships worth ₹30 cr
364.article_body: An 18-year-old student from US' Florida has been accepted into 27 top colleges in the country, including Harvard and Yale Universities, as well as the University of Pennsylvania. Jonathan Walker has been offered scholarships worth a total of $4 million (₹30.44 crore), reports said. Walker said he earned college credits through the International Baccalaureate Program.

365.title: Ravindra Jadeja's firing celebration after Maxwell's wicket goes viral
365.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja's firing celebration after taking the wicket of Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) all-rounder Glenn Maxwell in their IPL 2022 match has gone viral. Jadeja clean bowled Maxwell for 26(11) on the fifth delivery of RCB's seventh over. After taking the wicket, Jadeja made a gesture of firing with his left hand.

366.title: Malaysian sultan buys painting showing apes, frogs in parliament; pic surfaces
366.article_body: Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah Alhaj, the Sultan of Malaysia's richest state Selangor, purchased a painting of apes and frogs filling the benches of the country's parliament. This comes amid the government's delay over the proposed anti-party hopping law. "His Majesty agreed to buy the painting and hang it in his 'private study room'," an Instagram post by his office said.

367.title: Nearly 5 million Ukrainian children have fled their homes: UNICEF
367.article_body: UNICEF warned that about 4.8 million Ukrainian children have been forced to flee their homes since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. UNICEF's Emergency Programmes Director Manuel Fontaine said the death of 142 children, killed mostly by crossfire or explosions, has been confirmed. "In just six weeks, nearly two-thirds of all Ukrainian children have been displaced," he said.

368.title: Russia warns Sweden, Finland against NATO membership
368.article_body: Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov on Monday warned Sweden and Finland against joining NATO amid reports that both Nordic countries are looking to join the military alliance. Further expansion of NATO would "not bring stability to the European continent", Peskov added. "If they decide to apply, I expect that all allies will welcome them," NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said.

369.title: Ukraine stopped Russian hackers from damaging electricity grid: Govt
369.article_body: The Ukrainian government on Tuesday said that it had prevented Russian military hackers from damaging Ukraine's electricity grid with a cyberattack last week. Ukraine has been under steady Russian cyberattack for the past eight years, a top Ukrainian cybersecurity official said. The attacks have tripled since the invasion when compared with the same period last year, the official added.

370.title: John taught me how to ride a bike during 'Dhoom' shoot: Abhishek
370.article_body:
Abhishek Bachchan said John Abraham taught him how to ride a bike during the shoot of their 2004 movie 'Dhoom'. "My mother and my father never allowed me to ride because they were scared...John used to ride with me and teach me. He was unbelievable," he stated. "John said 
'baba, just remember. You have to be very responsible'," Abhishek added.

371.title: Sepp Blatter, Michel Platini to face FIFA corruption trial in June
371.article_body: Former FIFA President Sepp Blatter and former UEFA President Michel Platini will stand trial in a Swiss court over corruption allegations in June. Blatter, 86, and Platini, 66, were indicted on charges of fraud in November including a $2 million payment from FIFA to Platini in 2011. Blatter resigned in 2015 followed by Platini in 2016. Both deny the allegations.

372.title: 300 new One-Stop Centres to open for violence-hit women: Irani
372.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday said that the government plans to open additional One-Stop Centres (OSCs) to provide support to women affected by violence in private or public spaces, family, community, or at the workplace. Irani said that in collaboration with Women's Helplines, about 70 lakh women have been helped by the Central and state governments so far.

373.title: Viral video shows 20 electric scooters on fire in Maharashtra
373.article_body: A video showing around 20 electric scooters of Jitendra EV on fire in Maharashtra's Nashik is going viral on social media. The video shows fire department officials trying to douse the fire in the container truck that was transporting around 40 scooters. The exact cause of fire is yet to be ascertained by the authorities.

374.title: Air India plane damaged as tow tractor collides with it at Delhi airport
374.article_body: A Guwahati-bound Air India plane was damaged after a tow tractor collided with its nose while pushing it back for take-off at the Delhi airport on Tuesday, senior DGCA officials said. No one was injured in the incident and the 182-seater aircraft was grounded for inspection. Aviation regulator DGCA has initiated an investigation into the incident, officials added.

375.title: People seen lying on ground and bleeding after being shot at Brooklyn station
375.article_body: After mass shooting at a train station in US' Brooklyn on Tuesday, pictures showing people lying on the station and train floor and bleeding have surfaced online. At least 13 persons were injured, including five from gunshots, at the station. The suspect reportedly escaped the spot and was wearing a construction vest and a gas mask.

376.title: US cannot confirm use of chemical weapons in Ukraine: Official
376.article_body: After Ukraine claimed it is investigating unverified information that Russia may have used chemical weapons in Mariupol, a US defence official said that America cannot confirm the use of chemical agents in the city at this time. The US had no information to support the movement of chemical agents by Russia in or near Ukraine, the official added.

377.title: Awestruck: Axar recalls his and Bumrah's reaction on joining MI in IPL 2013
377.article_body: Recalling his and Jasprit Bumrah's reaction after joining MI in IPL 2013, Axar Patel, who currently represents DC, said both of them were awestruck after seeing Sachin Tendulkar, Rohit Sharma and other players in MI. He added that they were left wondering on what should they do as all "big stars" they used to see on television were present there.

378.title: Electoral bond one of the biggest scams in Indian democracy: Gehlot
378.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday described electoral bond scheme as "one of the biggest scams in Indian democracy", adding that it swings election process in favour of ruling party at Centre. Gehlot alleged that BJP puts pressure on industrialists to obtain donations through electoral bonds. "These bonds are becoming a way to use black money in elections," he added.

379.title: Man who threatened to kill Spain PM Sanchez jailed for 7.5 years
379.article_body: Spain's High Court on Tuesday sentenced a 65-year-old man to seven-and-a-half years in prison for threatening to assassinate Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on a far-right WhatsApp chat in 2018 and possessing illegal guns. Manuel Murillo Sanchez was sentenced to two-and-a-half years for attempted murder and five years for possession of war weapons.

380.title: British MP found guilty of sexually assaulting 15-year-old boy
380.article_body: British MP Imran Ahmad Khan on Monday was found guilty of sexually assaulting a 15-year-old boy after trying to force him to drink alcohol at a house in 2008. Khan, 48, had denied the allegation. Khan has since been suspended by Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Conservative Party while waiting for the outcome of the trial.

381.title: One producer told me I don't have looks to be an actor: Vivek Oberoi
381.article_body: Vivek Oberoi, who completed 20 years in Bollywood on Tuesday, recalled his early acting days and revealed that a producer once told him that he doesn't have the looks to be an actor. "I was really hurt," Vivek added. The actor further said, "I wanted a job on my own merit rather than my last name...and struggled for 18-29 months."

382.title: All options on the table: UK warns if Russia uses chemical weapons
382.article_body: British Armed Forces Minister James Heappey on Tuesday warned "all possible options are on the table" on how the West would respond if Russia used chemical weapons in Ukraine. "These are appalling weapons to think about using," he said. Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said the UK "will hold Putin and his regime to account" if chemical weapons are used.

383.title: Politician indicted on charge of insulting Thai King Maha Vajiralongkorn
383.article_body: Thai politician Thanathorn Juangroongruangkit was indicted on Monday on charges of insulting King Maha Vajiralongkorn and violating a cyber law. Juangroongruangkit, who now faces up to 20 years in prison, had criticised government last year for awarding contract of COVID-19 vaccines to a company owned by the King. He was granted release on bail of 90,000 baht (over ₹2 lakh).

384.title: Formation of Supertech's Committee of Creditors stayed till April 19
384.article_body: National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has stayed the formation of the Committee of Creditors in the Supertech insolvency case till April 19 as the real estate developer sought time to negotiate with banks. NCLAT has taken into consideration the concerns of all stakeholders, including homebuyers, said Ram Kishor Arora, the petitioner and director of the suspended board of Supertech.

385.title: I’ve got a car that is capable of winning: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc
385.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc said he has "a car that is capable of winning" following his victory at the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. "I know that it's in the car and I just have to do the job, so the mindset is a little bit different this year," Leclerc said. The 24-year-old currently leads the Driver Standings with 71 points.

386.title: Head of Russian artillery intelligence killed in Ukraine: Reports
386.article_body: The head of Russia's artillery intelligence has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Lieutenant Colonel Vyacheslav Savinov, 40, reportedly died last month in a fierce battle. Savinov was the deputy chief of staff of the Russian Missile Troops and Artillery. He is the 32nd Russian lieutenant colonel or colonel to be killed. Seven Russian generals have also reportedly been killed.

387.title: Currently focussed on IPL, hopeful to play for India one day: PBKS' Vaibhav
387.article_body: PBKS pacer Vaibhav Arora said he's currently focussed on playing in IPL, adding he wants to work on his form and give best results. "Haven't thought a lot about my future plans but if I continue with my good performance then one day hopefully I'll play for India," he added. Vaibhav has taken two wickets from two matches so far.

388.title: I'm not a man for predictions: Karthik on RCB's chances of winning IPL 2022
388.article_body: On being asked about his views on RCB's chances of winning IPL 2022, RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik replied, "(Laughs) I'm not a man for predictions. But I must say the mood in the camp is good." He added, "We are (heading) in a good direction." RCB are currently third in standings, having won three from four matches.

389.title: Poland takes over Russian compound in Warsaw to give to Ukrainians
389.article_body: A fenced compound in Poland's Warsaw, which was "unlawfully occupied" by Russians, will be made available for Ukrainian refugees, Mayor Rafal Trzaskowski said on Monday. The compound, which consists of several empty buildings, was built in a land-swap agreement between Soviet Union and Poland in 1970s and was considered disputed. Trzaskowski, however, added that the compound has been recovered.

390.title: People of Punjab will soon get good news: CM Bhagwant Mann
390.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said his government will soon give "good news" to the people of the state, indicating that it could announce 300 units of free electricity to households. The Opposition criticised AAP earlier today and alleged that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was trying to control the Punjab government through remote control.

391.title: CSK record highest total of IPL 2022, break DC's record
391.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) put up a total of 216/4 against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on Tuesday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far. The previous highest total in IPL 2022 was 215/5, which was recorded by Delhi Capitals (DC) against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). Shivam Dube top-scored for CSK with 95*(46), while Robin Uthappa scored 88(50).

392.title: 403 bodies found in Ukraine's Bucha after Russian retreat: Mayor
392.article_body: The Mayor of Bucha in Ukraine, Anatoliy Fedoruk, on Tuesday said that 403 bodies of people have been found in the town so far, following a retreat by Russian forces last month. Ukraine has accused Russian forces of killing civilians during their occupation of Bucha. Fedoruk claimed that it was too early for residents to return to the town.

393.title: I was taken to a nude couple after being intoxicated: Woman on sex racket in Delhi spa
393.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was rescued by Delhi Commission for Women and Delhi Police from a sex racket allegedly being operated inside a spa centre in Azadpur, Delhi. "She informed...she was given...intoxicant after which she started losing her senses...She was taken inside a room where there was a nude couple," a notice said. She alleged someone tried to rape her.

394.title: Gangrape survivor in PoK seeks PM Modi's help, says, 'allow us to come to India'
394.article_body: A gangrape survivor in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir has sought PM Narendra Modi's help in a video message that is being circulated online. Stating that she has been fighting for justice for past seven years, the woman said, "Allow us to come to India...The local police and a senior politician, Choudhary Tariq Farooq, will anytime kill me and my children."

395.title: Video of Brooklyn mass shooting surfaces, smoke seen inside train
395.article_body: A video from the site of the mass shooting in New York's Brooklyn has shown smoke pouring out of a train and commuters running away from it. At least 13 people were injured, including five from being shot at, at a Brooklyn subway station on Tuesday. Reports had suggested a possible explosion had occurred at the site of the attack.

396.title: Robin Uthappa records most sixes in an innings in IPL 2022
396.article_body: CSK opener Robin Uthappa on Tuesday recorded the most sixes in an innings in IPL 2022 so far. The 36-year-old slammed nine sixes against RCB, overtaking KKR all-rounder Andre Russell, who had slammed eight sixes against PBKS on April 1. Uthappa scored 88 runs off 50 deliveries, his highest-ever score in IPL.

397.title: Ropeway was shaking, passengers screamed: Tribals on J'khand cable car accident
397.article_body: Some tribals who rescued eight tourists from two cable cars after a ropeway accident in Jharkhand's Deoghar district shared what they saw at the time of the incident. A local said he heard a loud thud and the ropeway was shaking violently and the passengers were screaming. "I found panic-stricken people, including two girls, screaming inside the trolleys," he added.

398.title: If oil prices remain above $110 a barrel, burden will have to be shared: CEA
398.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor Dr V Anantha Nageswaran said if global crude oil prices remain above $110 per barrel for more than a quarter, then the burden will have to be shared by the government, oil marketing companies and consumers. He told CNBC-TV18, "The burden needs to be shared because this is a global supply shock...It hasn't been engineered by anyone."

399.title: Man held with 1.3 kg charas worth lakhs of rupees in J&K's Poonch
399.article_body: An alleged drug peddler was arrested in the Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir, police said on Tuesday. About 1.3 kilograms of charas, which is estimated to be worth lakhs of rupees, was also recovered from his possession. According to the police, he was intercepted on Monday after a police party found him moving suspiciously during patrolling.

400.title: Elephant kills Colombian researcher in Ugandan national park
400.article_body: A Colombian researcher, Sebastian Ramirez Amaya, was trampled to death by an elephant on Sunday in Uganda's Kibale National Park, according to Ugandan authorities. Amaya was researching a doctorate on the social lives of male and female chimpanzees. Notably, Amaya's death comes three months after a Saudi tourist was killed by an elephant in another national park in the country.

401.title: FIFA launch new digital streaming service, to include live games
401.article_body: FIFA has launched a new digital streaming service called FIFA+ which will include free live games and "Netflix style" documentaries. "This project represents a cultural shift in the way different types of football fans want to connect with and explore the global game," FIFA President Gianni Infantino said. The new platform will be funded by advertisers.
